segments.title: Definition of Density
segments.summary: Explains density as the ratio of mass to volume, measured in kg/m³ or g/cm³. Uses examples of water (1 g/cm³) and iron (7.8 g/cm³) to illustrate density measurements.

segments.title: Air Density Variation
segments.summary: Discusses how air density varies with altitude, from 0.1 g/cm³ at surface level to 0.004 g/cm³ at 10km altitude. Explains how atmospheric pressure affects air density.

segments.title: Density and Floating
segments.summary: Explains how objects with lower density float while those with higher density sink. Uses examples of oil floating on water and iron sinking in water.

segments.title: Water Density Temperature Relationship
segments.summary: Describes how water density changes with temperature, reaching maximum density at 4°C. Explains the unusual behavior of water density below 4°C.

segments.title: Water Bodies Cooling Process
segments.summary: Details how large water bodies cool through density-driven circulation, with colder, denser water sinking until reaching 4°C. Demonstrates the relationship between temperature and density in natural systems.
